summary: This is an email from defense attorney Christian Everdell submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's response to government letters regarding evidence from 'Accuser-3' in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The response is being submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who is submitting the defense's response to government letters regarding Accuser-3's evidence to the court.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN)), to whom the correspondence is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, whose legal team is submitting a response regarding evidence from Accuser-3.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Appears to be a prosecutor (SANYS likely stands for Southern District of New York) copied on the email regarding the case.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on the email regarding the submission of the response letter.

persons.name: Laura
persons.context: Recipient of the email, likely a member of Judge Nathan's chambers staff.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting a legal response on behalf of his client, Ghislaine Maxwell, in her criminal case.
Both are defense attorneys working on Ghislaine Maxwell's case, as indicated by both being on the correspondence.
Pagliuca is a prosecutor for the government, which is the opposing party in Maxwell's criminal case.
Everdell (defense) is corresponding with the court regarding a response to letters from Pagliuca's office (prosecution).

events.title: Government Letter Regarding Accuser-3 Evidence
events.description: The government submitted a letter to the court regarding evidence related to 'Accuser-3' in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Follow-up Government Letter
events.description: The government submitted a follow-up letter to the court regarding evidence related to 'Accuser-3'.

events.title: Defense Response Filed
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team prepared and filed a response letter to the government's November 5 and 7 letters regarding Accuser-3's evidence.

events.title: Response Submitted Under Seal
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell submitted the response to the court under temporary seal via email, allowing the government to propose redactions.

locations: 800 Third Avenue, New York (Cohen & Gresser LLP office)
keyFacts: The document is part of the pre-trial litigation in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, specifically concerning evidence from an individual referred to as 'Accuser-3'.
The defense is submitting its response to government letters under a temporary seal, indicating the sensitive nature of the evidence or arguments regarding Accuser-3.
The correspondence reveals the established protocol between prosecution and defense for submitting sensitive materials, allowing the government to propose redactions before public filing.
The case docket number is S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN), with Judge Nathan presiding.
The defense legal team includes Christian Everdell and Bobbi Sternheim from Cohen & Gresser LLP.
